measure:
3.0 <<<<<<< HEAD:resources/measures/ResidentialHVACFurnaceElectric/measure.xml process_furnace_electric 18ba60d7-82a7-45c7-a0ed-bafb828ca0e2 5aeea96a-cf66-4d0c-b516-ea17bd24fedb 20180410T212128Z 0DA5C9E6 ProcessFurnaceElectric Set Residential Furnace Electric This measure removes any existing HVAC heating components from the building and adds a furnace along with an on/off supply fan to a unitary air loop. For multifamily buildings, the furnace can be set for all units of the building. See https://github.com/NREL/OpenStudio-BEopt#workflows for supported workflows using this measure. Any heating components or baseboard convective electrics/waters are removed from any existing air/plant loops or zones. Any existing air/plant loops are also removed. An electric heating coil and an on/off supply fan are added to a unitary air loop. The unitary air loop is added to the supply inlet node of the air loop. This air loop is added to a branch for the living zone. A diffuser is added to the branch for the living zone as well as for the finished basement if it exists. ======= process_unit_heater 1a71ae9e-5485-4cca-a369-16c6b8a9c1d8 f568b9cb-08a4-4276-8490-92382f35abfe 20180416T163852Z 470FC630 ProcessUnitHeater Set Residential Unit Heater This measure removes any existing HVAC heating components from the building and adds a unit heater along with an optional on/off fan. For multifamily buildings, the unit heater can be set for all units of the building. See https://github.com/NREL/OpenStudio-BEopt#workflows for supported workflows using this measure. Any heating components or baseboard convective electrics/waters are removed from any existing air/plant loops or zones. Any existing air/plant loops are also removed. A unitary system with a fuel heating coil and an optional on/off fan are added to each zone. >>>>>>> master:resources/measures/ResidentialHVACUnitHeater/measure.xml
fuel_type Fuel Type Type of fuel used for heating. Choice true false gas
gas gas
oil oil
propane propane
wood wood
efficiency Efficiency The efficiency of the heater. Double Btu/Btu true false 0.78
fan_power Fan Power Fan power (in W) per delivered airflow rate (in cfm) of the fan. A value of 0 implies there is no fan. Double W/cfm true false 0
airflow_rate Airflow Rate Fan airflow rate as a function of heating capacity. A value of 0 implies there is no fan. Double cfm/ton true false 0
capacity Heating Capacity The output heating capacity of the heater. If using 'autosize', the autosizing algorithm will use ACCA Manual S to set the capacity. String kBtu/hr true false autosize
